title: Calories in a Ginger Ale
meta_description: Learn calories in a ginger ale for a standard 12 oz serving, including carbs, sugars, sodium, and quick diet tweaks to adjust intake.
assumptions: Regular ginger ale, 12 fl oz (355 ml) can, carbonated soft drink like Canada Dry; includes ginger flavoring and sugar.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, serving size, and formulation (e.g., high-fructose corn syrup vs. cane sugar). Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 12 oz can of ginger ale contains about 140 calories, primarily from sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add a splash of real ginger juice

faqs.q: How many calories in a ginger ale?
faqs.a: About 140 calories in a standard 12 oz can of regular ginger ale.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in ginger ale?
faqs.a: Yes, around 36 g of carbs per 12 oz can, all from sugars with 0 g fiber.

faqs.q: What's the sugar content in a ginger ale?
faqs.a: Typically 36 g of sugars per 12 oz serving, equivalent to about 9 teaspoons.

faqs.q: How many calories in diet ginger ale?
faqs.a: Zero calories, as it's sweetened with artificial sweeteners instead of sugar.
